Research Interests Chen’s research lies in the theory of Data Mining, Data-Driven AI, Data Valuation, and their applications in Recommender Systems Knowledge Graphs Natural Language Processing Social Computing/Social Good Opening: I am looking for self-motivated PostDoc and PhD students who are interested in pursuing data mining and machine learning research in recommender systems, knowledge graphs, natural language processing, or social computing. Feel free to shoot me an email (allenmc1230@gmail.com), with your CV, transcript, and publication. A Chinese version about openings. Note: I am open to any kind of collaboration, feel free to shoot me an email if you have any ideas. Biography Chen is an Assistant Professor in the Department of Computer Science, at the City University of Hong Kong since August 2021. Before that, Chen got his PhD from the School of Computer Science, McGill University, supervised by Prof. Xue (Steve) Liu. In the meantime, he also closely worked with Prof. Mark Coates. Before joining McGill, he received his MS and BS degrees in Software Engineering from Beijing Institute of Technology. He is also a core developer of a Java open-source library on recommender systems–LibRec.
